intro: Paragynoxys lopezii, commonly known as the Lopezii paragynoxys, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
